content:
• Monday, July 15, 2013
  • BRO

    More on Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q2 beats across the board on a 12% jump in total revenue....

    More on Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q2 beats across the board on a 12% jump in total revenue. Retail commissions and fees were up 6.7% to $168.58M. Wholesale brokerage commissions and fees climbed 14.2% to $52.86M. National programs commissions were up 18.3% to $62.86M, while services fees rose 10% to $30.27M. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 PM
  • STLY

    More on Stanley Furniture (NASDAQ:STLY): Q2 misses on all counts as total revenue came in flat...

    More on Stanley Furniture (NASDAQ:STLY): Q2 misses on all counts as total revenue came in flat on a Y/Y basis. Gross margin declined to 9% of net sales compared to 14.5% in the prior year period. The company attributes the miss to disruptions related to the launch of its new enterprise system. Shares -6.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • MILL

    Miller Energy (NYSE:MILL): FQ4 EPS of -$0.31 misses by $0.2. Revenue of $7.73M misses by $3.87M....

    Miller Energy (NYSE:MILL): FQ4 EPS of -$0.31 misses by $0.2. Revenue of $7.73M misses by $3.87M. Shares -1.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM
  • HSII

    Heidrick & Struggles (NASDAQ:HSII) makes a number of corporate announcements. First, L....

    Heidrick & Struggles (NASDAQ:HSII) makes a number of corporate announcements. First, L. Kevin Kelly, is resigning as CEO and from the company's board. Jory Marino, regional leader of its Americas unit, will serve as Interim chief executive. The company also expects Q2 net revenue to be at the high end of its previous guidance range of $110M - $120M when results are reported later this month. Analysts are forecasting revenue of $114M. In addition, after evaluating strategic alternatives, its board has decided that at this time a standalone strategy is the best way to maximize value for shareholders. Shares -11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM
  • MTSN

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NQ +8%. MTSN +3%. BRO +2%. GDP +2%. GTE +1%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: NQ +8%. MTSN +3%. BRO +2%. GDP +2%. GTE +1%.
    After-hours top losers: CTAS -4%. BERY -4%. PFLT -3%. AMRE -3%. ITMN -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • MPC

    Marathon Petroleum (NYSE:MPC) says it sees Q2 EPS coming in at $1.75-1.85. The figure includes a...

    Marathon Petroleum (NYSE:MPC) says it sees Q2 EPS coming in at $1.75-1.85. The figure includes a $0.12/ share charge for pension settlement expenses. The company says "lower crude oil price differentials and product realizations compared to spot market value" negatively affected the refining and marketing segment during the period. Shares -1.98% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 5 Comments
  • CTAS

    Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS) issues FY14 guidance to go along with its FQ4 earnings report: The company...

    Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS) issues FY14 guidance to go along with its FQ4 earnings report: The company sees EPS for the coming year between $2.66-2.75 on revenue of $4.5-4.6B. The outlook "assumes no deterioration in the U.S. economy and does not consider any additional share buybacks." Consensus is for $2.79/ share on sales of $4.54B. Shares -3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • BRO

    Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q2 EPS of $0.36 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $325.8M beats by $7.1M....

    Brown & Brown (NYSE:BRO): Q2 EPS of $0.36 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $325.8M beats by $7.1M. Shares +3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • BERY

    Berry Plastics (NYSE:BERY) -4.5% AH after filing to sell 15M shares in a secondary offering (13%...

    Berry Plastics (NYSE:BERY) -4.5% AH after filing to sell 15M shares in a secondary offering (13% of outstanding shares), on behalf of former P-E owners Apollo Global and Graham Partners. The filing comes after Berry estimated its FQ3 (June quarter) sales totaled $1.22B-$1.23B, below a $1.26B consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • JOEZ

    Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ) sinks 12.3% AH as the company misses on both the top and bottom line...

    Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ) sinks 12.3% AH as the company misses on both the top and bottom line for Q2. From the report: Gross margin falls 300 basis points on product mix and rising production costs for the Vintage Reserve line. Operating income falls to $2.1M from $3.1M in Q2 2012. Comps in the retail segment fall 6% due to tough compares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • WWAV

    WhiteWave Foods (NYSE:WWAV): Q2 preliminary EPS of $0.16 in-line. Preliminary Revenue of $616M...

    WhiteWave Foods (NYSE:WWAV): Q2 preliminary EPS of $0.16 in-line. Preliminary Revenue of $616M (+10% Y/Y) beats by $7.83M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile (NQ) +9.5% AH after announcing its expects to report Q2 revenue of $40M, above prior...

    NQ Mobile (NQ) +9.5% AH after announcing its expects to report Q2 revenue of $40M, above prior guidance of $38.5M-$38.8M and a consensus of $38.6M. The mobile security software vendor also says it's buying the 45% of mobile device management software vendor NationSky it doesn't already own for $25.2M ($11M in cash + $14.2M in stock). SA contributor Steven Weitz talked up NQ's prospects earlier this month. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • INSM

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) announces a $60M public stock offering. All shares are to be sold by INSM....

    Insmed (NASDAQ:INSM) announces a $60M public stock offering. All shares are to be sold by INSM. The company plans to use the proceeds to fund further clinical and regulatory development of its lead product candidate, Arikace, and to invest in third-party manufacturers and the supply chain in order to establish and commercial supply capability in advance of the launch of the drug in Europe and the U.S. Leerink Swann is acting as sole book-running manager for the offering. Shares -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • CTAS

    Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS): FQ4 EPS of $0.69 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.13B (+7.2% Y/Y) in-line....

    Cintas (NASDAQ:CTAS): FQ4 EPS of $0.69 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $1.13B (+7.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -3.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • WLL

    Whiting Petroleum (NYSE:WLL) closes the sale of its Enhanced Oil Recovery projects to BreitBurn...

    Whiting Petroleum (NYSE:WLL) closes the sale of its Enhanced Oil Recovery projects to BreitBurn Energy (BBEP) for net proceeds of $836M. The company also updates Q2 guidance saying production exceeded the high end of its previous outlook at 8.5 MMBOE, an increase of 15.7% Y/Y. Shares -3.25% AH after the update. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 4 Comments
  • VERU

    The Female Health Company (FHCO -6.4%) finishes the day lower after warning that its FQ3 unit...

    The Female Health Company (FHCO -6.4%) finishes the day lower after warning that its FQ3 unit shipments will trail year-ago levels by an unspecified amount. The company, which makes the FC2 female condom, says it still expects to remain profitable over the period, noting that its "long-term outlook remains positive."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • JOEZ

    Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ): Q2 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $30.9M (+8% Y/Y) misses...

    Joe's Jeans (NASDAQ:JOEZ): Q2 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $30.9M (+8% Y/Y) misses by $1.11M. Shares -3.23% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • VIEW

    Cogo (COGO +23.9%) soars after founder/CEO Jeffrey Kang proposes to buy 30.5% of the company's...

    Cogo (COGO +23.9%) soars after founder/CEO Jeffrey Kang proposes to buy 30.5% of the company's assets (responsible for 98.7% of its revenue) for $80M, through a wholly-owned company. Kang's company would also be required to pay Cogo's remaining units $750K/quarter until the end of 2014. Cogo is closing trading with a market cap of $79.9M. This isn't the first time Kang has made such a proposal.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • ALXN

    Alexion (ALXN -5.7%) could be worth as much as $208/ share in a takeout, Piper Jaffray thinks...

    Alexion (ALXN -5.7%) could be worth as much as $208/ share in a takeout, Piper Jaffray thinks (this is the call Jim Cramer was so incredulous about Monday morning). Analyst Ian Somaiya believes investors can expect multiple bids for the company. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • QTRH

    Shares of Wi-LAN (WILN -24%) come off a trading halt and promptly collapse — the company...

    Shares of Wi-LAN (WILN -24%) come off a trading halt and promptly collapse — the company says a trial jury has ruled against it in ongoing patent litigation. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN +6.2%) trades up after completing its underwritten public offering of 21.7M ADSs...

    Amarin (AMRN +6.2%) trades up after completing its underwritten public offering of 21.7M ADSs late Friday, generating proceeds of approximately $121.1M. The company intends to use the net proceeds primarily to continue the commercial launch of Vascepa, and, if approved, advance its cardiovascular outcomes trial. On a separate note, Vascepa's NCE status was not listed in the recent June Orange Book.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • CENT

    Shares of Central Garden & Pet Co. (CENT +3.5%) are moving notably higher on more than twice...

    Shares of Central Garden & Pet Co. (CENT +3.5%) are moving notably higher on more than twice their average 10-day volume. Perhaps helping the cause is SA Pro contributor Investing 501 who says — in a still-embargoed article — the stock has a FCF yield of 14% and could offer investors a 50-100% upside if the company's restructuring program "can yield a sustained improvement in margins."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • YOKU

    Chinese Internet stocks are turning in a good day after the government unveils a new telecom...

    Chinese Internet stocks are turning in a good day after the government unveils a new telecom plan promising to increase fiber-to-the-home deployments, improving 3G connectivity, and issue 4G licenses by year's end. YOKU +6.2%. BIDU +4.7%. QIHU +4.8%. DANG +4.9%. YY +9.2%. CYOU +5.2%. China's telecom giants aren't moving much: CHL +0.3%. CHA -0.4%. CHU +1%. (more on China/4G)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • AMCC

    More on Raymond James' upgrade of AppliedMicro (AMCC +13.5%): Like others on the Street, RJ's...

    More on Raymond James' upgrade of AppliedMicro (AMCC +13.5%): Like others on the Street, RJ's Hans Mosesmann is upbeat about the potential of AppliedMicro's ARM-based X-Gene server CPUs, which (along with rival products) are set to go into H-P's Moonshot servers. Mosesmann declares X-Gene to be "6-12 months ahead of 64-bit ARM competitors" (Marvell, AMD, Texas Instruments, etc.), and expects it to grab "the lion's share" of the ARM server CPU market for the next 2-3 years. FBR argued last month X-Gene, aimed at a budding microserver market, "represents the most complete vision of an ARM server SoC," and praised AppliedMicro's integration of an on-chip switch controller.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • CNX

    Brean Murray's Lucas Piper likes what he sees in Consol Energy's (CNX +1.1%) Q2 operations...

    Brean Murray's Lucas Piper likes what he sees in Consol Energy's (CNX +1.1%) Q2 operations update, saying that overall, the coal results were better than estimates. Piper adds that the numbers confirm a recovery is largely underway in thermal coal, which can be evidenced by the company's new low Northern Appalachian thermal coal inventories. The firm reiterates its Buy on the shares with a $46 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • XPO

    XPO Logistics (XPO +11.1%) spikes after the company says it will buy 3PD for $365M ($357M in...

    XPO Logistics (XPO +11.1%) spikes after the company says it will buy 3PD for $365M ($357M in cash and $8M in restricted stock), a move that is expected to be "immediately and significantly accretive to earnings." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • SODA

    Sodastream (SODA +1.9%) quickly tanks but then regains its footing on the recycling of a rumor...

    Sodastream (SODA +1.9%) quickly tanks but then regains its footing on the recycling of a rumor Green Mountain (GMCR +5.4%) is set to compete with Keurig seeking a trademark for a carbonated drink maker.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • CYD

    China Yuchai (CYD -2.9%) slips after naming Weng Ming Hoh as its new president, effective July...

    China Yuchai (CYD -2.9%) slips after naming Weng Ming Hoh as its new president, effective July 17. Hoh has been holding dual positions as acting president and CFO since the departure of the previous President on May 31, 2013. He will relinquish his position as CFO with his appointment as president.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • ALXN

    Deutsche's Robyn Karnauskas talks Alexion (ALXN -4.6%) and gives investors a bit more color on...

    Deutsche's Robyn Karnauskas talks Alexion (ALXN -4.6%) and gives investors a bit more color on why the rumored deal with Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY -0.7%) may not materialize: "From Roche's perspective [there is a] lack of strategic fit, synergies and high valuation vs risks." Karnauskas adds that although "the deal looks less expensive on revenue multiple basis … our EU pharma team is very skeptical." Commenting on the myriad offering prices being thrown around, Cramer quips that he "doesn't make up the numbers, he just reports them." (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • NTAP

    More on Morgan Stanley's upgrade of NetApp (NTAP +2.7%): Analyst Katy Huberty says checks point...

    More on Morgan Stanley's upgrade of NetApp (NTAP +2.7%): Analyst Katy Huberty says checks point to improving 2H sales and pent-up storage demand. She expects shares to benefit from these trends, as well as low expectations and a favorable valuation. Q1 industry storage sales were soft, thanks to both subdued IT spending and a shift in hardware spend toward Web/cloud data centers (many of which are filled with commodity hardware). NetApp is making new 52-week highs, and is up 21% YTD. (restructuring and dividend/buyback hikes: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • T

    Midday top 10 gainers: LEAP +114%. IQNT +32%. FFEX +22%. TAYC +21%. LDK +19%. ADGE +17%. STP...

    Midday top 10 gainers: LEAP +114%. IQNT +32%. FFEX +22%. TAYC +21%. LDK +19%. ADGE +17%. STP +17%. JKS +16%. AMCC +15%. GFED +14%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: BMJ -13%. INGR -10%. ARTW -9%. AEHR -9%. OTC:MDXG -8%. NCTY -8%. FHCO -7%. VSEC -7%. CRMB -7%. IMMY-OLD -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • EXC

    Exelon (EXC +1.2%) presents its first sustainability report as a combined company following its...

    Exelon (EXC +1.2%) presents its first sustainability report as a combined company following its 2012 merger with Constellation, saying that it's merged goal is now for emission cuts of 17.5M metric tons by 2020. The company notes that at the end of 2012, it had already achieved 89% of its original, stand-alone goal by reducing, offsetting or displacing more than 14M metric tons of emissions - which is equivalent to taking more than 2.9M cars off the road every year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 4 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +3.1%) is flying high today after a fire on another Dreamliner last week caused a bit...

    Boeing (BA +3.1%) is flying high today after a fire on another Dreamliner last week caused a bit of panic by investors, who feared another possible grounding was on the way. The stock has gained back much of its initial 7% plunge on the news, as flights of the airliner, at least for now, continue unabated.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 6 Comments
  • CSIQ

    Lazard upgrades Canadian Solar (CSIQ +13.9%) to Buy, leading shares to add to the gains they...

    Lazard upgrades Canadian Solar (CSIQ +13.9%) to Buy, leading shares to add to the gains they were seeing on news China's electricity regulator is now backing the government's 35GW 2015 solar installation target. For those keeping score, CSIQ is now up 287% YTD. (mixed shelf filing)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • RSH

    RadioShack (RSH +3.3%) rallies after TheDeal discusses its buyout potential (video). The site...

    RadioShack (RSH +3.3%) rallies after TheDeal discusses its buyout potential (video). The site observes new CEO Joe Magnacca helped turn around Duane Reade while it was owned by P-E firm Oak Hill, prepping the drugstore chain for a sale to Walgreen. Much as he did at Duane Reade prior to its sale, Magnacca has been busy renovating RadioShack's stores and refreshing the company's product lineup, with an eye towards selling more high-margin goods.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • ACUR

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +5.4%) says it plans to immediately start developing an upgraded...

    Acura Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ACUR +5.4%) says it plans to immediately start developing an upgraded version of its Nexafed tablet using the second generation prototype formulation of its methamphetamine-resistant Impede technology. The improved formulation would make the drug - which is is currently approved for distribution through national and regional drug wholesalers to chain and independent drugstores nationwide - harder to tamper with.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • BWEN

    Broadwind Energy (BWEN +2.6%) moves up this morning after announcing it's received $87M in new...

    Broadwind Energy (BWEN +2.6%) moves up this morning after announcing it's received $87M in new tower orders from a U.S. wind turbine manufacturer. The company will produce the towers through its facilities in Wisconsin and Texas, with delivery scheduled for 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • AU

    AngloGold Ashanti (AU -3.1%) slips after revising down its annual guidance to 4-4.1Moz from...

    AngloGold Ashanti (AU -3.1%) slips after revising down its annual guidance to 4-4.1Moz from 4.1-4.4Moz citing the company's strategy "to remove marginal ounces from its production profile [and] prevailing gold prices." AU also says it expects to book a charge of $2.6B in Q2 on "impairments and revaluation to net realizable value of its mining assets." Q2 production should come in at 935Koz, in line with guidance. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • ARDNA

    Arden Group (ARDNA +11%) shares remain halted after saying it's retained Moelis & Company as...

    Arden Group (ARDNA +11%) shares remain halted after saying it's retained Moelis & Company as an advisor and begun the process to "explore and evaluate strategic alternatives," including a possible sale of the company. The owner of supermarkets in Southern California said it hasn't decided to pursue a specific strategic transaction and noted there is no defined timeline for the review.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • NES

    Nuverra Environmental Solutions (NES +6.7%) jumps after announcing an agreement with Halliburton...

    Nuverra Environmental Solutions (NES +6.7%) jumps after announcing an agreement with Halliburton (HAL -1.5%) wherein the two companies will work together to advance HAL's H2O Forward Service which allows customers to recycle waste water for use in well completions. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 7 Comments
  • RVLT

    Revolution Lighting (RVLT +11.5%) soars after announcing P-E firm Aston Capital is creating a...

    Revolution Lighting (RVLT +11.5%) soars after announcing P-E firm Aston Capital is creating a fund to finance LED lighting purchases/installations for RVLT customers. The fund, known as LightCap I, has set an initial funding target of $50M, a provided ~$4M in LED project financing in Q2. The announcement comes a couple weeks after RVLT shares fell thanks to a critical report from TheStreetSweeper.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • FET

    Forum Energy Technologies (FET -3%) takes a hit after updating Q2 guidance, saying it expects...

    Forum Energy Technologies (FET -3%) takes a hit after updating Q2 guidance, saying it expects its EPS to be in the range of $0.32 to $0.34, down from previous guidance of between $0.35 and $0.40. The company said the drop could be attributed to weak demand for its drilling and flow equipment products. The company also says it's acquired Moffat 2000, a manufacturer of subsea pipeline inspection gauge launching and receiving systems, and subsea connectors.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • INGR

    Ingredion (INGR -9.7%) warns on its Q2 today, saying that a slide in profits from two of South...

    Ingredion (INGR -9.7%) warns on its Q2 today, saying that a slide in profits from two of South America's largest economies that began in June would likely continue through the rest of the year as company finds it tough to pass on cost increases to consumers. Profits are now expected to come in around 14% below prior projections, and Q2 EPS is projected to be $1.15 - $1.20, compared to $1.33 in the same quarter in 2012. For FY13, the company expects an EPS of $5.10 - $5.40, below the Street's consensus of $5.86.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • CY

    Cypress (CY -2.7%) slides after receiving a downgrade to Hold from Feltl, and a 2-notch...

    Cypress (CY -2.7%) slides after receiving a downgrade to Hold from Feltl, and a 2-notch downgrade to Underperform from CLSA. The downgrades come ahead of the SRAM/touch controller vendor's Thursday Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • LDK

    Solar stocks enjoy a bright session as China says it will up its installed solar capacity to 35...

    Solar stocks enjoy a bright session as China says it will up its installed solar capacity to 35 gigawatt over the next two years in a move Bloomberg says is designed to "help reduce the industry’s reliance on exports and ease oversupply that contributed to a 20% plunge in the average price of solar panels last year." LDK +12.5%, DQ +2.33%, JKS +10.7%, TSL +11%, SPWR +5.2%, SUNE +5.79%, YGE +7.75%, CSIQ +7.62%, STP +9.96%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 3 Comments
  • ARUN

    Aruba (ARUN +3%) launches a new $100M buyback program to replace a similar program (launched in...

    Aruba (ARUN +3%) launches a new $100M buyback program to replace a similar program (launched in June '12) that was recently exhausted. The authorization is good for buying 5% of shares at current levels. It arrives with shares down sharply from their March highs thanks to May's bad earnings news (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • IQNT

    Inteliquent (IQNT +32.7%) skyrockets after raising its 2013 revenue guidance to $215M-$225M from...

    Inteliquent (IQNT +32.7%) skyrockets after raising its 2013 revenue guidance to $215M-$225M from $200M-$210M, and its adjusted EBITDA guidance to $57M-$62M from $34M-$40M. Also, the wholesale voice traffic seller is lowering its capex forecast to $12M-$16M from $14M-$18M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • QCOM

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Qualcomm (QCOM -1.6%) has been cut to Neutral by...

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Qualcomm (QCOM -1.6%) has been cut to Neutral by Lazard. 2) NetApp (NTAP +2.6%) has been upgraded to Overweight by Morgan Stanley. 3) ExOne (XONE -5.8%) has been cut to Hold by BB&T. 4) AppliedMicro (AMCC +13.2%) has been upgraded to Strong Buy by Raymond James. 5) Portugal Telecom (PT-OLD -2.8%) has been cut to Underperform by BNP Paribas. 6) eGain (EGAN +2.8%) has been started at Outperform by Northland. 7) Himax (HIMX +2.1%) has been started at Buy by Craig-Hallum. 8) American Tower (AMT -1.4%) has been cut to Neutral by ISI. 9) QLogic (QLGC -3.8%) has been cut to Underweight by Morgan Stanley. 10) Linear (LLTC -1%) has been cut to Neutral by Credit Suisse.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • NEPT

    Neptune Technologies and Bioresources (NEPT -2.5%) reports a consolidated net loss of $5.4M for...

    Neptune Technologies and Bioresources (NEPT -2.5%) reports a consolidated net loss of $5.4M for Q1 on $6.1M in revenue. The company says it still expects to restart production at Sherbrooke by the end of the year. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • RNN

    Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (RNN +6.3%) says Teva (TEVA -0.6%) has submitted an IND for the small...

    Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (RNN +6.3%) says Teva (TEVA -0.6%) has submitted an IND for the small molecule chemotherapy agent RX-3117. The companies established a commercialization and development agreement for the drug in 2009.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • FBIO

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO) files a registration with the SEC to sell up to $200M in stocks,...

    Coronado Biosciences (CNDO) files a registration with the SEC to sell up to $200M in stocks, units or warrants from time to time. Shares -3.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • POWI

    Power Integrations (POWI +6.8%) raises its Q2 revenue guidance range to $87M-$88M from a prior...

    Power Integrations (POWI +6.8%) raises its Q2 revenue guidance range to $87M-$88M from a prior $79M-$85M; the consensus is at $82.5M. Moreover, gross margin is now pegged at 53%-53.5%, above prior guidance of 52%-53%. The analog chipmaker says it's seeing "significant growth" in all of its major end-markets. Shares are making new 52-week highs; full results arrive on July 30.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • DECK

    Deckers Outdoors (NASDAQ:DECK) jumps 2.88% premarket after Piper hikes its price target on the...

    Deckers Outdoors (NASDAQ:DECK) jumps 2.88% premarket after Piper hikes its price target on the shares to $68 from $52 in an upgrade to Overweight from Neutral. Analyst Erinn Murphy cites "a backdrop of strong brand equity" and says operating margins could reach the higher teens over time (from an estimated 12.6% this year). "Every 100 basis points in operating margin equates to $0.33 in incremental earnings," Murphy adds.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 5 Comments

  • Market Preview: U.S. stock futures build on earlier gains after the Empire State Manufacturing...

    Market Preview: U.S. stock futures build on earlier gains after the Empire State Manufacturing survey slays expectations, although retail sales were a bit of a damp squib.   • RIOT

    Venaxis (APPY) says the external Data & Safety Monitoring Board created for the trial of the...

    Venaxis (APPY) says the external Data & Safety Monitoring Board created for the trial of the company's APPY1 Test has recommended continuing the study based on two futility analyses that were carried out on 579 patients. The trial will enroll a total of 2,000 patients for the APPY1 Test, which identifies patients who are at low risk of appendicitis. Shares are -5.1%, possibly because Venaxis expects to complete recruitment by the end of 2013 rather than in August, as previously forecast, and file for FDA clearance in Q1 2014. (PR)

    Given Imaging (GIVN +6.5%) gains approval from Japan's Pharmaceuticals & Medical Devices...

    Given Imaging (GIVN +6.5%) gains approval from Japan's Pharmaceuticals & Medical Devices Agency for the company's PillCam Colon video capsule for diagnosing colonic disease. The authorization could expand Given's potential customer base in the country to 10,000 doctors from about 1,000, and help in enhancing adherence to screening guidelines for over 1M potential patients. Reimbursement of the PillCam is expected to become effective during H1 next year. (PR)

  • C

    More on Citigroup (NYSE:C) Q1 earnings: Loan loss release of $784M (about $0.25/share) vs. $1B a...

    More on Citigroup (NYSE:C) Q1 earnings: Loan loss release of $784M (about $0.25/share) vs. $1B a year ago. Allowance for loan losses drops to 3.4% of total loans from 4.3% a year ago. Roughly $600M (about $0.19/share) of DTA used, bringing total used YTD to $1.3B (DTA is about $55B). Citi Holdings assets cut by $60B to $131B, now 7% of total assets. Global consumer banking revenue up 2%, with North America off 1%. In line with JPMorgan and Wells, company expects retail banking to take a hit from slower mortgage business. Tier 1 Capital Ratio up 20 bps to 13.3%. Book value/share up $0.51 to $63.02. "Banker To The World," Citigroup made the Barron's cover over the weekend. CC at 10 ET. Shares +1.7% premarket. (PR)

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) -8.5% premarket after announcing preliminary FQ1 revenue of between...

    OCZ Technology (NASDAQ:OCZ) -8.5% premarket after announcing preliminary FQ1 revenue of between $50M-$55M, well shy of expectations of $74M. The company blames the continued tight supply of NAND flash and says there was $23M of unrealized shippable backlog during the Q. Gross margins improved and are expected at 17-20%. Cash burn fell to about $6M, with cash on hand at quarter's end expected to be $6M-$7M. "The company expects that it will require access to additional capital and which it is currently in the process of securing." (PR)
